config.title: Blood pressure quiz
config.intro_copy:
Around 30% of people in England have high blood pressure but many don't know it. If left untreated, high blood pressure increases your risk of a heart attack or stroke.
It's important to know what affects our blood pressure and what you can do to keep your blood pressure at a healthy level.
Take this short quiz and see how much you know. You can check your answers as you go and you'll get a score at the end.
config.intro_copy_alt:
Around 30% of people in England have high blood pressure (hypertension) but many don't know it. If left untreated, high blood pressure increases your risk of a heart attack or stroke.

It's important to know what affects our blood pressure and what you can do to keep your blood pressure at a healthy level.

Take this short quiz and see how much you know. You can check your answers as you go and you'll get a score at the end.

q.title: New question
q.body: How many people do you think have high blood pressure in England? Select one:

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false?
 
'If you don’t have any symptoms you don’t need a blood pressure test'

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false?

'If high blood pressure runs in your family there is nothing you can do to stop developing high blood pressure yourself.'

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false?

'If you have high blood pressure you will need to take medication for life.'

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false?

'I don’t add extra salt to my food so my blood pressure can’t be high.'

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false?

'If a man is obese he is 4 times more likely to develop high blood pressure.'

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false? 

'I had my blood pressure checked around 5 years ago so I know my blood pressure is low'

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false? 

'You need to make an appointment and see your GP to get a blood pressure test.'

q.title: New question
q.body: What conditions can high blood pressure lead to? You can pick more than one:

q.title: New question
q.body: What factors are known to increase the risk of developing high blood pressure? You can pick more than one.

a.body: Too much salt in your diet
Family history of high blood pressure

results.ri:
Oh dear. You don't know very much about blood pressure. Take action today and learn more about the risks, causes and treatment for high blood pressure. The more you know, the better you can protect your health. 

You can go back to the questions and check your answers and below is an overview of the blood pressure facts:
  • 1 in 4 (a quarter) of people in England have high blood pressure (hypertension)
  • High blood pressure doesn't usually cause symptoms
  • Simple lifestyle changes can significantly lower your blood pressure without medication
  • Cutting down on salt will reduce blood pressure but it is not the only cause
  • Obesity multiplies the risk of developing high blood pressure
  • Your blood pressure can fluctuate which is why we should get tested at least every 5 years
  • You can get tested with your GP, a nurse, healthcare assistant or pharmacy or by using self-service machines and home monitors
  • 40 – 74 year olds can be tested through the free NHS Health Check
  • High blood pressure is a risk factor for heart attack, stroke, kidney disease and dementia
  • Being overweight, too much salt, not being active enough, drinking too much alcohol, stress and family history are all risk factors

Well done, you know quite a bit about blood pressure. Learn more about the risks, causes and treatment for high blood pressure. The more you know, the better you can protect your health. 

You can go back to the questions and check your answers and below is an overview of the blood pressure facts:
  • 1 in 4 (a quarter) of people in England have high blood pressure (hypertension)
  • High blood pressure doesn't usually cause symptoms
  • Simple lifestyle changes can significantly lower your blood pressure without medication
  • Cutting down on salt will reduce blood pressure but it is not the only cause
  • Obesity multiplies the risk of developing high blood pressure
  • Your blood pressure can fluctuate which is why we should get tested at least every 5 years
  • You can get tested with your GP, a nurse, healthcare assistant or pharmacy or by using self-service machines and home monitors
  • 40 – 74 year olds can be tested through the free NHS Health Check
  • High blood pressure is a risk factor for heart attack, stroke, kidney disease and dementia
  • Being overweight, too much salt, not being active enough, drinking too much alcohol, stress and family history are all risk factors

Brilliant! You really know your stuff when it comes to blood pressure. Learn more about the risks, causes and treatment for high blood pressure. The more you know, the better you can protect your health. 

You can go back to the questions and check your answers and below is an overview of the blood pressure facts:
  • 1 in 4 (a quarter) of people in England have high blood pressure (hypertension)
  • High blood pressure doesn't usually cause symptoms
  • Simple lifestyle changes can significantly lower your blood pressure without medication
  • Cutting down on salt will reduce blood pressure but it is not the only cause
  • Obesity multiplies the risk of developing high blood pressure
  • Your blood pressure can fluctuate which is why we should get tested at least every 5 years
  • You can get tested with your GP, a nurse, healthcare assistant or pharmacy or by using self-service machines and home monitors
  • 40 – 74 year olds can be tested through the free NHS Health Check
  • High blood pressure is a risk factor for heart attack, stroke, kidney disease and dementia
  • Being overweight, too much salt, not being active enough, drinking too much alcohol, stress and family history are all risk factors

links.li: With high blood pressure affecting over a quarter of all adults in England it is important that everyone takes the time to get checked and to take action to lower their risk. Here are some links to articles that you might find useful:

result_items.ri: You were wrong. A diagnosis of high blood pressure does not necessarily mean that you need to begin on medication. Lifestyle changes such as a healthier diet or more physical activity can significantly lower it without medication.

You were right. A diagnosis of high blood pressure does not necessarily mean that you need to begin on medication. Lifestyle changes such as a healthier diet or more physical activity can significantly lower it without medication.

link_items.ri: Learn more about high blood pressure
Read all about having a healthier heart
Learn about the over 40s NHS Health Check

ib.title: Check your answer
ib.body: More than 1 in 4 (a quarter) of people  in England have high blood pressure. It is one of the biggest causes of premature death and disability.
ib.name: Check your answer
